discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is label for unmatched. This way, one can set a label for those elements that do not fit in an specific breakdown and decide if they are that numerous so that a new breakdown should be associated. about this option can be found here: Exam4lead.com

Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is label for unmatched. This way, one can set a label for those elements that do not fit in an specific breakdown and decide if they are that numerous so that a new breakdown should be associated. Info about this option can be found here:
https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/xanadu-now-intelligence/page/use/performance-analytics/task/t_DefiningABreakdownSource.html

C. Label for unmatched

- EXPLANATION:
Explanation:
When you select an indicator as the data source, you can filter the results by breakdown and 
breakdown element. 
If you have the 'Label for unmatched' field defined on the breakdown source for a selected 
breakdown, this label appears in your choice of Elements. 
Select the label to display scores that do not match any of the elements. 
This option helps provide views into whether you need to create additional breakdowns or adjust 
data values. 
Reference: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/quebec-servicenow-platform/page/use/par-for- 
workspace/task/create-visualization.html

The option on the breakdown source record that helps provide views into whether you need to create additional breakdowns or adjust data values is "Run Diagnostics" . This feature is utilized after installing any Platform Analytics Solutions to run all diagnostics on all records, which can catch many mismatches between the configuration of your Platform Analytics Solutions and your tables, thereby indicating if adjustments or additional breakdowns are needed.

questions.question_text: What option on the breakdown source record helps provide views into whether you need to create additional breakdowns or adjust data values?
Which of the following are true statements about configuring pie, donut, and single score visualisations in workspaces?

discussion.content:
Regarding configuring pie, donut, and single score visualizations in workspaces, the true statements are:

A. Data labels are shown as only percentages, as values, or as both. You have options for how data labels are displayed in these visualizations, including showing values, percentages, or both, enhancing the information presented in an easily understandable format .

B. Legend percentages are shown along with values. This feature allows for a detailed understanding of the data by showing not only the values but also what percentage of the total each value represents, directly in the legend .

C. The metric label name is displayed near the metric value. This ensures clarity and quick recognition of what the displayed data represents, making it easier for users to interpret the visualizations without needing to refer back to other parts of the UI for context .

choices.A: Data labels are shown as only percentages, as values, or as both.
choices.D: Set gradient, texture, or no colour options for data display.
choices.B: Legend percentages are shown along with values.
choices.C: The metric label name is displayed near the metric value.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Users with the pa_viewer role can create personal targets. Users with the pa_target_admin or admin roles can create global targets.

Selected Answer: A
The answer is A. The No Role is outdated and was for the Quebec version

To create personal targets and thresholds for users who can view an indicator on the Analytics Hub, the role required is "pa_viewer". This role enables users to view Performance Analytics data, and it also allows them to set personal targets and thresholds for the indicators they have access to, enhancing their ability to monitor and react to changes in key performance indicators relevant to their responsibilities.

questions.question_text: What role is required to create personal targets and thresholds for users who can view an indicator on the Analytics Hub?
Which of the following are suggested when you type in a query on Analytics Q&A? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
ABD are correct. The Analytics Q&A doesn't show "Breakdowns"

When typing in a query on Analytics Q&A, the suggestions that are offered include recent searches, indicators, and tables and columns that match what you have typed so far. Only the tables and columns to which you have access are shown. This makes A. Recent searches, B. Tables and columns, and D. Indicators the correct answers .

An easy way for a responsible user to get real-time updates on the signals for a particular KPI is to receive email notifications. When a signal is detected on a KPI for which they are responsible, or when other signal-related events occur, responsible users can receive automatic email notifications. This ensures they are promptly informed about significant changes or updates related to their KPIs without the need to continuously monitor dashboards or manually check for signals. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Receive email notifications.

choices.D: Manually check the KPI doe signals
choices.A: Monitoring the signal score on a dashboard
choices.C: Schedule a report for the signal data

questions.question_text: What is an easy way for a responsible user to get real-time updates on the signals for a particular KPI?
